doc:
Gina Manès https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gina_Man%C3%A8s 0 Gina Manès (7 April 1893 – 6 September 1989) was a French film actress and a major star of French silent cinema. After an early appearance in a film of Louis Feuillade, she had significant roles in films of Jean Epstein, including Cœur fidèle, and of Germaine Dulac. In Abel Gance's Napoléon, she took the part of Joséphine de Beauharnais, and then played the title role in Jacques Feyder's Thérèse Raquin (now lost). She made the transition to sound films but during the 1930s her roles diminished in importance, and periods of residence in Morocco took her further from the public eye. She continued to take small roles in films, and also worked in the circus and in the theatre. In total Manès appeared in over 90 films between 1916 and 1966. Gina_Manès ( 7_April_1893 – 6_September_1989 ) was a_French_film_actress and a_major_star of French_silent_cinema . After an_early_appearance in a_film of Louis_Feuillade , she had significant_roles in films of Jean_Epstein , including Cœur_fidèle , and of Germaine_Dulac . In Abel_Gance 's_Napoléon , she took the_part of Joséphine de Beauharnais , and then played the_title_role in Jacques_Feyder 's_Thérèse_Raquin (_now_lost ) . She made the_transition to_sound films but during the_1930s_her_roles diminished in importance , and periods of residence in Morocco took her_further from the_public_eye . She continued_to_take small_roles in films , and also worked in the_circus and in the_theatre . In total_Manès appeared in over_90_films between 1916_and_1966 .
